task: Line $ k $ is defined by $ y = 9x - 4 $. Line $ j $ is perpendicular to line $ k $ in the xy-plane. What is the slope of line $ j $?
explanation:
Choice B is correct. Since line $ j $ is perpendicular to line $ k $, its slope is the opposite reciprocal of the slope of line $ k $. 
The equation for line $ k $ is given as $ y = 9x - 4 $, meaning its slope is $ 9 $. 
The opposite reciprocal of $ 9 $ is $ - rac{1}{9} $. 
Thus, the slope of line $ j $ is $ - rac{1}{9} $.
